body:
I've had a go at fixing this here.

It detects if we are updating an existing archive tier blob and deletes it first.

I find this change slightly concerning though - I wonder if it should be enabled with a flag?

Can you give it a go please?

[v1.54.0-beta.4943.d5d470526.fix-4819-azureblob-tier](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4819-azureblob-tier/v1.54.0-beta.4943.d5d470526.fix-4819-azureblob-tier/) on branch [fix-4819-azureblob-tier](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4819-azureblob-tier) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

> I've had a go at fixing this here.
> 
> It detects if we are updating an existing archive tier blob and deletes it first.
> 
> I find this change slightly concerning though - I wonder if it should be enabled with a flag?
> 
> Can you give it a go please?
> 
> [v1.54.0-beta.4943.d5d470526.fix-4819-azureblob-tier](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4819-azureblob-tier/v1.54.0-beta.4943.d5d470526.fix-4819-azureblob-tier/) on branch [fix-4819-azureblob-tier](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4819-azureblob-tier) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)


Given that there is potential consequence for deleting Archive-Tier data off of an Azure Blob (in the form of delete fees), I would say that having this delete before option be a flag would be the right way to go.

I'm running somebody else's image of RClone in Docker (https://github.com/romancin/rclonebrowser-docker) so I will work on standing something up using the new branch when I get done with work... ETA 6 hrs

@ncw  Looks like we have a winner!

What I executed:

- Downloaded the rclone-v1.54.0-beta.4943.d5d470526.fix-4819-azureblob-tier-windows-amd64.zip to my Windows machine
- Unzipped
- CMD'ed into the directory and created a placeholder rclone.conf
- Replaced rclone.conf with the one from my Linux host
- Did a dry run (Source, Remote, & File removed for privacy):

```
rclone.exe sync --delete-before --dry-run --progress SOURCE REMOTE
2020-11-30 13:28:37 NOTICE: FILE: Skipped copy as --dry-run is set
2020-11-30 13:28:37 NOTICE: FILE: Skipped copy as --dry-run is set
Transferred:             0 / 0 Bytes, -, 0 Bytes/s, ETA -
Checks:              1128 / 1128, 100%
Transferred:            2 / 2, 100%
Elapsed time:         4.1s
```

- Did a full run (Source, Remote, & File removed for privacy):

```
rclone.exe sync --delete-before --progress SOURCE REMOTE
Transferred:        6.490G / 6.490 GBytes, 100%, 48.405 MBytes/s, ETA 0s
Checks:              1128 / 1128, 100%
Transferred:            2 / 2, 100%
Elapsed time:      2m20.0s
```

No errors!  Sync completed!

Coming back to your "should this be a flag?"... Def YES I only deleted a small handful of Archive-Tier files from my Azure Blob yesterday and was charged $0.37 for it: If somebody had a LOT of files to delete, those Archive-Tier delete charges could add up FAST. While it's not RClone's responsibility to watch for data-store charges, it would be a very nice to have feature.

Thank you for testing.

What do you think the flag should be called, I suggest `--azure-blob-update-archive` maybe? This would be a config flag `update_archive`.

If `true` this flag would delete archive tier blobs before attempting to update them. The help should probably mention that deleting archive tier blobs early costs money.

if `false` (the default) rclone should probably give an error `Can't update archive tier blobs without --azureblob-update-archive` - or maybe it could carry on anyway like it does at the moment and eventually return the `RESPONSE Stats: 409 This operation is not permitted on an archived blob` error.  Returning the `Can't update...` error is nice and user friendly so that is probably the thing to do provided we are certain you'll never be able to update an Archive tier blob.

Thoughts on the above?

I wouldn't necessarily use the word 'update'.  'Update' involves updating the data which is not possible with a blob that is in Archive-Tier.

While I think it would be fun to think of this as a general flag for Azure Blobs that replaces the functionality of the RCLONE --delete-before with the DELETE from Azure CLI (instead of POST or whatever RClone uses naitively) so that RClone would delete the old data before beginning a copy/sync, we can scope this as something Azure Blob Achieve-Tier specific.

I'd recommend something laser specific for this:

`--azure-blob-archive-tier-delete`   

For `true`, your idea is spot on.  I'd also think about having it over-write any of the --delete-before, --delete-during, or --delete-after flags (or anything else that may propagate a conflict on deleting).  No need for the CLI to pop a warning on billing cost, that kind of warning can be added to the RClone documentation.

For `false`, the error message idea is spot on...  It's be pretty bling if RCLONE could check the status of the blob (is archive?), and if it is achieve, pop the error and skip the file, else upload.  It would be cool if the error provided a few words to reference the documentation but we don't need the error to propagate a full essay.

Love it...  Your ideas/fix are awesome
@ivandeex  sorry, I hit submit early... I've updated my comment if you wish to review

I've had a go with the flag here - can you give it a test please @GoingOffRoading - comments on wording appreciated too :-)

[v1.54.0-beta.4957.bdee61e7e.fix-4819-azureblob-tier](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4819-azureblob-tier/v1.54.0-beta.4957.bdee61e7e.fix-4819-azureblob-tier/) on branch [fix-4819-azureblob-tier](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4819-azureblob-tier) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

#### --azureblob-archive-tier-delete

Delete archive tier blobs before overwriting.

Archive tier blobs cannot be updated. So without this flag, if you
attempt to update an archive tier blob, then rclone will produce the
error:

    can't update archive tier blob without --azure-blob-archive-tier-delete

With this flag set then before rclone attempts to overwrite an archive
tier blob, it will delete the existing blob before uploading its
replacement.  This has the potential for data loss if the upload fails
(unlike updating a normal blob) and also may cost more since deleting
archive tier blobs early may be chargable.


- Config:      archive_tier_delete
- Env Var:     RCLONE_AZUREBLOB_ARCHIVE_TIER_DELETE
- Type:        string
- Default:     ""

Oops got the type of the flag wrong... Try this

[v1.54.0-beta.4957.4d4d91336.fix-4819-azureblob-tier](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4819-azureblob-tier/v1.54.0-beta.4957.4d4d91336.fix-4819-azureblob-tier/) on branch [fix-4819-azureblob-tier](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4819-azureblob-tier) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

#### --azureblob-archive-tier-delete

Delete archive tier blobs before overwriting.

Archive tier blobs cannot be updated. So without this flag, if you
attempt to update an archive tier blob, then rclone will produce the
error:

    can't update archive tier blob without --azure-blob-archive-tier-delete

With this flag set then before rclone attempts to overwrite an archive
tier blob, it will delete the existing blob before uploading its
replacement.  This has the potential for data loss if the upload fails
(unlike updating a normal blob) and also may cost more since deleting
archive tier blobs early may be chargable.


- Config:      archive_tier_delete
- Env Var:     RCLONE_AZUREBLOB_ARCHIVE_TIER_DELETE
- Type:        bool
- Default:     false
Sorry @ncw , it took me a little time to generate new files that created the Azure Blob Achieve Tier error...  I have those files now and am testing your branch

Testing:  rclone-v1.54.0-beta.4957.4d4d91336.fix-4819-azureblob-tier-windows-amd64.zip

Excellent error message:  

```
"2020-12-19 20:57:33 ERROR : FILENAME: Failed to copy: can't update archive tier blob without --azure-blob-archive-tier-delete"`
```

Got an error trying to use the flag:

```
C:\rclone2>rclone.exe sync --delete-before --progress --azure-blob-archive-tier-delete X:\SOURCE REMOTE:DIRECTORY
Error: unknown flag: --azure-blob-archive-tier-delete
Usage:
  rclone sync source:path dest:path [flags]

Flags:
      --create-empty-src-dirs   Create empty source dirs on destination after sync
  -h, --help                    help for sync

Use "rclone [command] --help" for more information about a command.
Use "rclone help flags" for to see the global flags.
Use "rclone help backends" for a list of supported services.

2020/12/19 20:58:39 Fatal error: unknown flag: --azure-blob-archive-tier-delete
```
@ncw  let me know if you want me to test out any variants or etc
